terms_of_use.name: NeuroElectro
terms_of_use.contribution_model: creative commons BY-SA lic., cite original publication and a NeuroElectro publication (or URL to NeuroElectro)

terms_of_use.name: NeuroMorpho
terms_of_use.contribution_model: Data used from NeuroMorpho: Must include all three-1. The original paper(s) that describe the reconstructions, which appear(s) as a Pubmed link in the detailed metadata page of each reconstruction, 2.The complete name: NeuroMorpho.Org, and 3. Either: Ascoli GA (2006) Mobilizing the base of neuroscience data: the case of neuronal morphologies. Nature Rev. Neurosci., 7:318-324 or Ascoli GA, Donohue DE, Halavi M. (2007) NeuroMorpho.Org: a central resource for neuronal morphologies.J Neurosci., 27(35):9247-51
terms_of_use.citation_policy: Data contributed to NeuroMorpho: To cite NeuroMorpho.Org in a publication, as an online repository where your original data can be found-1. if data has already been contributed to NeuroMorpho.Org, then state that the data "has been submitted to and will be available at NeuroMorpho.Org" and 2. if data is not yet contributed to NeuroMorpho.Org but will be in the near future then state that the data "will be submitted to NeuroMorpho.Org".

terms_of_use.name: NeuronDB
terms_of_use.data_type: three types of neuronal properties: voltage gated conductances, neurotransmitter receptors, and neurotransmitter substances

terms_of_use.name: Cell Image Library
terms_of_use.data_type: public repository of reviewed and annotated images, videos, and animations of cells from a variety of organisms, showcasing cell architecture, intracellular functionalities, and both normal and abnormal processes.
terms_of_use.contribution_model: offers a variety of licensing options for selection by submitters (http://www.cellimagelibrary.org/pages/license). Would like to receive notification of use from users.

terms_of_use.name: NeuroML database
terms_of_use.data_type: relational database that provides a means for exchanging these NeuroML model descriptions and their components.

terms_of_use.name: Open Source Brain
terms_of_use.data_type: a resource for sharing and collaboratively developing computational models of neural systems.

terms_of_use.name: Brain Maps
terms_of_use.data_type: an interactive, multiresolution next-generation brain atlas that is based on over 140 million megapixels of sub-micron resolution, annotated, scanned images of serial sections of both primate and non-primate brains and that is integrated with a high-speed database for querying and retrieving data about brain structure and function over the internet.
terms_of_use.contribution_model: All image content on BrainMaps.org, unless otherwise noted, is copyright the image dataset owners (denoted by the 'source' field associated with image datasets), and if none indicated, the UC Regents Davis campus. All rights reserved. You are free to use any image content on this site for personal or academic use, or for research purposes. The source of the content must be clearly indicated as BrainMaps.org. If commercial interests are involved, you must contact the University of California, Davis, Technology Transfer Services at copyright-at-ucdavis.edu to request a license. The exceptions to this are screenshots, which are released under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License, and which permits modifications and commercial use, with attribution to brainmaps.org. This only applies to screenshots.
terms_of_use.citation_policy: Citation policy: BrainMaps: An Interactive Multiresolution Brain Atlas; http://brainmaps.org [retrieved on DATE] or Mikula, S., Trotts, I., Stone, J., and Jones, E.G. 2007. Internet-Enabled High-Resolution Brain Mapping and Virtual Microscopy. NeuroImage. 35(1):9-15
